# characterEncoding

**Instance Property**

Sets the character encoding of the receiver to `encoding`,

## Declaration

```swift
var characterEncoding: String? { get set }
```

## Parameters

- **encoding**: A string that specifies an encoding; it must match the name of an IANA character set. See [http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets] for a list of valid encoding specifiers.

## Discussion

Typically the encoding is specified in the XML declaration of a document that is processed, but it can be set at any time. If the specified encoding does not match the actual encoding, parsing of the document might fail.

## Managing Document Attributes

- **documentContentKind**: Sets the kind of output content for the receiver.
- **dtd**: Returns an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTD] object representing the internal DTD associated with the receiver.
- **isStandalone**: Sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the receiver represents a standalone XML document.
- **mimeType**: Returns the MIME type for the receiver.
- **version**: Sets the version of the receiver’s XML.
